spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Amber casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Amber makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

action.name: Arcane Burst
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d10 + 3}) psychic damage.

action.name: Invisibility {@recharge 4}
entries: Amber magically turns {@condition invisible} for up to 1 hour or until she attacks, forces a creature to make a saving throw, or her {@status concentration} is broken (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). Any equipment Amber wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with her.

reaction.name: Instinctive Charm {@recharge 4}
entries: When a visible creature within 30 feet of Amber makes an attack roll against her, Amber forces the attacker to make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker redirects the attack roll to the creature closest to it, other than Amber or itself. If multiple eligible creatures are closest, the attacker chooses which one to target.

Amber Thrazgad is the Laird of the Clan Thrazgad in Gracklstugh, renown armor smiths and arcane users with the ability to enchant ore with magical properties. She is even tempered, overconfident, and boisterous and has a strong sense of community.

trait.name: Duergar Resilience
entries: Amber has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being {@condition charmed} or {@condition paralyzed}.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, Amber has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

bonus.name: Enlarge X2 (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, Amber magically increases in size, along with anything she is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, Amber is Large, doubles her damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If Amber lacks the room to become Large, she attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

trait.name: Duergar Resilience
entries: Horgar has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being {@condition charmed} or {@condition paralyzed}.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, Horgar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Gauntlets of Ogre Power
entries: Horgar wields {@item Gauntlets of Ogre Power} giving him a Strength score of 19 (+4).

trait.name: Brave
entries: Horgar has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Dwarven Thrower
entries: Horgar wields a {@item Dwarven Thrower}. This war hammer has the thrown property with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. When Horgar hits a creature with a ranged attack using this weapon, it deals an extra {@damage 1d8} damage (included in the attack) or, if the target is a giant, {@damage 2d8} damage. Immediately after the attack, the weapon flies back to his hand.

trait.name: Cape of the Mountebank
entries: Horgar wears a {@item Cape of the Mountebank}

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Deepking fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Horgar makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Enlarge X2 (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, Horgar magically increases in size, along with anything he is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, Horgar is Large, doubles his damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If Horgar lacks the room to become Large, he attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

action.name: Invisibility X2 (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Horgar magically turns {@condition invisible} until he attacks, casts a spell, or uses his Enlarge, or until his {@status concentration} is broken, up to 1 hour (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). Any equipment Horgar wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with him.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, Horgar can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that he can see within 30 feet of Horgar makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a {@dice d4} to its roll provided it can hear and understand Horgar. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if Horgar is {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Dwarven Thrower
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage,  {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) when thrown or enlarged.  {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) if thrown while enlarged, {@h}12 ({@damage 1d10 + 7}) if used with both hands, and {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) while enlarged.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: Horgar adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit him. To do so, Horgar must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

reaction.name: Dwarven Plate
entries: If an effect moves Horgar against his will along the ground, he can use his reaction to reduce the distance he is moved by up to 10 feet.

Deepking Horgar V ascended to the throne in 1372 DR. He is a ruthless and canny ruler who engages in secret meetings with all the city's councils and clans to keep their members guessing what he's up to, hands out favors out of the blue, and lets it be known that he'll use any trick to maintain his hold on power. This includes hiring assassins through third parties to take care of potential troublemakers. This strategy keeps all the city's factions at each other's throats and out of Horgar's way.

Like many other duergar in the city, Horgar Steelshadow V has been touched by the demon lords' madness. Roll on the {@table Indefinite Madness} table in {@book chapter 8|DMG|8|Madness} of the {@i Dungeon Master's Guide} to determine Horgar's flaw.

legendary.name: Demands of Nessus (1 Action)
entries: At the start of each of Horgar's turns, he can choose one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. The chosen ally loses 10 hit points, and Horgar regains the same number of hit points. If Horgar is {@condition incapacitated}, he makes no choice; instead, the closest ally within 30 feet is the chosen ally.

legendary.name: Cape of the Mountebank (2 Actions)
entries: Horgar uses his cape of the mountebank to cast dimension door, provided that itis currently charged.

legendary.name: Dwarven Thrower (1 Action)
entries: Horgar makes one melee or ranged weapon attack with his dwarven thrower.

trait.name: Exploit Opening (3/Day)
entries: When Grinta makes an attack, they have advantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Duergar Resilience
entries: Grinta has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being {@condition charmed} or {@condition paralyzed}.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, Grinta has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Grinta makes two attacks using Grab, Haymaker, Ironhead Knife, or any combination of the three.

action.name: Grab
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, or 9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) while under the effect of Enlarge, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, Grinta can't grab another creature.

action.name: Haymaker
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, or 11 ({@damage 3d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage against a {@condition grappled} target.

action.name: Haymaker while Enlarged
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, or 15 ({@damage 6d4}) bludgeoning damage against a {@condition grappled} target.

action.name: Throw
entries: Grinta throws one Medium or smaller creature they are grappling or object they are holding up to 30 feet horizontally. If the thrown target is a creature, they fall {@condition prone} after this throw. If the thrown target would enter the space of a creature or solid object that is no more than one size smaller than it, the thrown target collides with it and stops in the nearest unoccupied space, taking 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. A Large or smaller creature hit by this thrown target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take the same amount of damage and fall {@condition prone}.

action.name: Invisibility (Recharge after short or long rest)
entries: Grinta magically turns {@condition invisible} until they attacks, casts a spell, or uses their Enlarge, or until their {@status concentration} is broken, up to 1 hour (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). Any equipment Grinta wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with them.

action.name: Ironhead Knife
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, or 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage while enlarged.

reaction.name: Meat Shield
entries: When Grinta is grappling a target and is hit by a ranged attack made by another creature Grinta can see, Grinta gains a +2 bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If this bonus causes the attack to miss Grinta, it hits the {@condition grappled} target instead.

bonus.name: Enlarge (Recharge after short or long rest)
entries: For 1 minute, Grinta magically increases in size, along with anything they are wearing or carrying. While enlarged, Grinta is Large, doubles their damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If Grinta lacks the room to become Large, they attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

bonus.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, Grinta can move up to their speed toward a hostile creature that they can see.

Grinta Ironhead a hot tempered young duergar and the granddaughter of Laird Thangus Ironhead. Grinta impatiently longs for change within Gracklstugh, growing exceedingly tired of old customs and traditions that no longer serve the greater populace, or more importantly, themself. They are aggressive and tactless in most their dealings and an incredibly dangerous opponent in brawl.

trait.name: Duergar Resilience
entries: Ylsa has advantage on saving throws against spells and the {@condition charmed}, {@condition paralyzed}, and {@condition poisoned} conditions.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, Ylsa has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Ylsa makes two Mind-Poison Dagger attacks. She can replace one attack with a use of Mind Mastery.

action.name: Mind-Poison Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage, or 1 piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage while under the effect of Reduce.

action.name: Invisibility {@recharge 4}
entries: Ylsa magically turns {@condition invisible} for up to 1 hour or until she attacks, forces a creature to make a saving throw, or her {@status concentration} is broken (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). Any equipment Ylsa wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with her.

action.name: Mind Mastery
entries: Ylsa targets one creature she can see within 60 feet of her. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Intelligence saving throw, or Ylsa causes it to use its reaction, if available, either to make one weapon attack against another creature Ylsa can see or to move up to 10 feet in a direction of Ylsa choice. Creatures that can't be {@condition charmed} are immune to this effect.

bonus.name: Reduce (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, Ylsa magically decreases in size, along with anything she is wearing or carrying. While reduced, Ylsa is Tiny, her weapon damage to 1, and attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws are at disadvantage if she uses Strength. She gains a +5 bonus to all Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks and a +5 bonus to its AC. Ylsa can also take a bonus action on each of her turns to take the {@action Hide} action.

Ylsa is a mild tempered and meticulous merchant in the Darklake District of Gracklstugh and holds a seat on the Merchant Council. She is incredibly adept at knowing how to manipulate individuals to gain the information she desires. Preferring to use the art of conversation over the art of war. She runs a lucrative caravan and information operation out of her shop and knows nearly everything there is to know about everyone in the city.

trait.name: Duergar Resilience
entries: Gorglak has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being {@condition charmed} or {@condition paralyzed}.

trait.name: Phalanx Formation
entries: Gorglak has advantage on attack rolls and Dexterity saving throws while standing within 5 feet of a duergar ally wielding a shield.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, Gorglak has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Gorglak makes two Warhammer or Javelin attacks. He can use Command in place of one of these attacks.

action.name: Vicious Drow Warhammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage if used with both hands, plus 10 ({@damage 1d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Vicious Drow Warhammer (Enlarged)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, or 14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage if used with both hands, plus 10 ({@damage 1d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +4} to hit, range 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Javelin (Enlarged)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +4} to hit, range 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Command
entries: Gorglak targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of him. If the target can see and hear Gorglak, the target can make one weapon attack as a reaction.

action.name: Maneuver Allies {@recharge 5}
entries: Up to four allies within 60 feet of Gorglak that can hear him can each use their reaction to move up to half their speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

action.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, Gorglak magically increases in size, along with anything he is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, Gorglak is Large, doubles his damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If Gorglak lacks the room to become Large, he attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

action.name: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Gorglak magically turns {@condition invisible} until he attacks, casts a spell, or uses his Enlarge, or until his {@status concentration} is broken, up to 1 hour (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). Any equipment Gorglak wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

Gorglak is a hot tempered and cruel officer within the Stone Guard of Gracklstugh. He ranks directly under Errde Blackskull and longs to replace her, wanting first to completely humiliate her. His corruption and greed know no bounds - we will lie, bribe, and if he has to steel to get his way. He has an expansive collection of rare and powerful weapons.

reaction.name: Dwarven Plate
entries: If an effect moves Gorglak against his will along the ground, he can use his reaction to reduce the distance he is moved by up to 10 feet.

trait.name: Duergar Resilience
entries: Errde has advantage on saving throws against spells and the {@condition charmed}, {@condition paralyzed}, and {@condition poisoned} conditions.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, Errde has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Errde makes three Psychic-Attuned Hammer and uses Call to Attack.

action.name: Psychic-Attuned Hammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, or 15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage while under the effect of Enlarge, plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) psychic damage.

action.name: Call to Attack
entries: Up to three allies within 120 feet of Errde that can hear her can each use their reaction to make one weapon attack.

action.name: Invisibility {@recharge 4}
entries: Errde magically turns {@condition invisible} for up to 1 hour or until she attacks, forces a creature to make a saving throw, or her {@status concentration} is broken (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). Any equipment Errde wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with her.

bonus.name: Enlarge X2 (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, Errde magically increases in size, along with anything she is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, Errde is Large, doubles her damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If Errde lacks the room to become Large, she attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

reaction.name: Scouring Instruction
entries: When an ally that Errde can see makes a {@dice d20} roll, Errde can roll a {@dice d6}, and the ally can add the number rolled to the {@dice d20} by taking 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage.

reaction.name: Dwarven Plate
entries: If an effect moves Errde against her will along the ground, she can use her reaction to reduce the distance she is moved by up to 10 feet.

Errde Blackskull is Captain of the Stone Guard and one of the most respected duergar in Gracklstugh. She is an even tempered and calculating woman who is motivated by a great sese of responsibility. As a leader she is cunning, inspiring, and merciless in equal parts and will stop at nothing to rid her city of corruption.
